meanings.definition: To remove sacred or holy status from something.
meanings.sent1: The ancient curse desanctifies the sacred temple.
meanings.sent2: The vandal desanctifies the church by defacing its walls.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel desanctifies the garden by digging up all the flowers.
meanings.sent4: The storm desanctifies the peaceful landscape with its destructive power.
meanings.sent5: The careless actions desanctify the once revered artifact, tarnishing its significance.

meanings.definition: To make something no longer considered sacred or holy.
meanings.sent1: The modern art exhibition desanctifies traditional artistic norms.
meanings.sent2: The new law desanctifies outdated customs and beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy desanctifies the solemn ceremony by running around joyfully.
meanings.sent4: The loud music desanctifies the quiet atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent5: The bright neon lights desanctify the historic building, giving it a modern twist.
